meanings.definition: The quality of being inconvenient or poorly timed.
meanings.sent1: The inopportuneness of the rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: Her arrival at such an inopportune time caused a delay.
meanings.sent3: The inopportuneness of the fire alarm going off during the movie made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The inopportuneness of the thunderstorm during the outdoor wedding was like nature's cruel joke.
meanings.sent5: The inopportuneness of the car breaking down on the way to the airport made us miss our flight.

meanings.definition: The state of being unsuitable or inappropriate for a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: The inopportuneness of wearing flip-flops to a formal event was evident.
meanings.sent2: His joke at that moment was met with an awkward silence due to its inopportuneness.
meanings.sent3: The inopportuneness of the cat walking across the stage during the play added unexpected humor.
meanings.sent4: The inopportuneness of the power outage during the important presentation left everyone in the dark, literally.
meanings.sent5: The inopportuneness of the loud sneeze during the quiet moment of the concert was impossible to ignore.
